alert.note: Alert for Douglas; Franklin (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 31 at 1:48AM CDT by NWS Topeka
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Franklin and south central Douglas Counties through 215 AM CDT... At 147 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 5 miles east of Centropolis, moving southeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down small tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Ottawa and Wellsville. This includes Interstate 35 between mile markers 188 and 198. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
